Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge unreasonably assessed the evidence and applied the qualitative test for citizenship
Credibility_Assessment: Judge found credibility issues regarding applicant's absences and representations
Evidence_Type: Credit card use, residency records, travel history
Legal_Provision: Residence requirements under the Citizenship Act
Basis_of_Claim: Centralized mode of existence (qualitative test) and physical presence (quantitative test)
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Undeclared absences, credit card discrepancies, dual residency indicators
Application_Error: Failure to rigorously analyze contradictory evidence and justify findings
Review_Outcome: Decision found unreasonable; remanded to Minister for redetermination
Evidence_Ignored: Contradictory evidence on absences and financial activity abroad
Application_Factor: Residency, physical presence, center of life
Decision_Outcome: Citizenship application denied due to insufficient and erroneous assessment
Decision_Review_Issue: Unreasonable assessment of evidence and misapplication of legal test
Cause_of_Refusal: Undeclared absences, credibility concerns, dual residency patterns
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistent credit card use, lack of documentation for absences
Credibility_Issues: Applicant's truthfulness regarding residence and travel
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of Citizenship Judgeâ€™s factual findings
Procedural_Issue: Adequacy of reasoning in administrative decision
